intro: Tribulus eichlerianus, commonly known as the Eichler's cat's claw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Zygophyllaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically small, opposite, and covered in fine hairs, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Tribulus eichlerianus is often found growing on rocky soils and is well-suited to drought-prone environments.
